title: A Balance Suggestion Against Manaless Champions
body: I'm sure we are all annoyed while we're using mana for spells and our lane enemy doesn't. What I suggest is an upper-hand chance for mana depending champions. It's like when there is a manaless enemy champion in 750 aoe, our champion should gain %75 mana regen. Numbers can be changed, but I hope you understand what I mean. Doesn't it be good?

replies.body:
The whole purpose of mana-less champions is to be able to stay in lane longer because you don't have mana costs on abilities to hold you down. 

First off, for champions that take energy, they cannot spam their spells as much as mana-users. Their energy regenerates much faster than mana, but they have a very low amount of energy, so they trade quick regeneration for not having being able to last in longer fights while spamming spells.

Champions that use health for abilities sacrifice health in order to use abilities, which can be dangerous. I know that most of the champions that do that can easily regain that health, but abilities such as Vladimir's E cannot be spammed forever because of the stacking health cost, at least in early game. Also, a lot of them have longer cooldowns. Take Aatrox, for instance. Both his Q and E have pretty long cooldowns.

Basically, it's a fundamental part of the kit of these champions to be able to spam abilities. That's just how they work. Being able to use their abilities more often than their lane opponents is a very important part of their kits.

to add onto that, champions with abilities completely without resource costs are usually gated by comparable long cooldowns. garen and renekton for example have no cooldown below 8 seconds in their kits. shyvanas q has a base cooldown of 6 seconds at rank 5, but is relatively unspectacular. even rivens base cooldowns are not that short (except for her shield). her q is on 13 seconds at all ranks, her w is on 11 to 7 seconds.

basically while mana dependent champs need to invest into mana items to keep themselves going, resourceless champs usually have to invest into cdr instead, to achieve the same cooldowns as you guys by lategame.

yasuo is the exception, but balanced out by the fact that hes pretty squishy in melee despite his his shield, and that all of his abilites are highy conditional.

the only ability that has no conditions attached is his wind wall, which is on a really long cooldown in return.
Something along the lines of When within 1500 range of a manaless champion, restore 1% missing mana every second?
